title: Sri Lanka power regulator asks social media ban to be removed
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka has asked the telecom regulator and operators to lift a social media ban imposed ahead of planned protests on Sunday as it was not able to communicate with electricity consumer about power cuts.

“As PUCSL is unable to inform the consumers of electricity (declared as an essential service) about impending power cuts, PUCSL requests TRC and all Mobile operators to activate/restore all social media platforms immediately,” the regulator said in a statement.
Sri Lanka’s telecom regulator has ordered networks to block social media channels until further notice, operators told customers Sunday after they lost contact overnight.

Sri Lanka’s President Gotabaya Rajapaksa invoked emergency regulations, slapped a curfew till Monday and barred gatherings in a series of gazettes issued at midnight after a social media activists planned nation-wide protests Sunday.
